name: ResCons
tagline: A Bioinformatics GUI software suite - Assists in residue conservation analysis
body:
# ResCons ResCons is a GUI software suite, made of seven tools, that can be used to assist in analysis of residue conservation. It is written in Python 2.7 and can be run in Windows, Mac and Linux (Ubuntu). *Installers/executables are available for Windows, Mac and Linux. See below.* PS: ResCons was previously called ResCon (https://github.com/ManavalanG/ResCon). ## Downloads 1. [Installer for Windows](https://github.com/ManavalanG/ResCons/releases/download/v1.0/ResCons_v1.0_setup_Windows_Installer.exe) 2. [Executable for Mac](https://github.com/ManavalanG/ResCons/releases/download/v1.0/ResCons_v1.0_Mac_Executable.zip) 3. Executable for Linux will be available soon. 4. [Python script and dependable files of ResCons](https://github.com/ManavalanG/ResCons/releases/download/v1.0/ResCons_v1.0_Script.zip) ## Tools in ResCons 1. Mismatch Analyzer
2. Subtree Sequences Extractor
3. GenPept/GenBank to FASTA Converter
4. Filter BLAST by Bit or E-value
5. Filter FASTA by Sequence’s ID
6. Filter FASTA by Sequences’ Description
7. FASTA Description / ID Extractor
See the [user guide](https://github.com/ManavalanG/ResCons/blob/master/User_Guide_ResCons.pdf) for further details about ResCons’s tools.
## Authors and Contributors Manavalan Gajapathy (@ManavalanG)
Joseph D. Ng
Ng Lab, University of Alabama in Huntsville
### Support Having trouble? Check out the user guide that is available as part of the software. If you still need help, try reaching us at mg0010@uah.edu Author: Manavalan Gajapathy, Joseph D. Ng, University of Alabama in Huntsville
